head.title: World Business Briefing | Europe: Germany: Economic Views Vary

identified-content.classifier: Top/Classifieds/Job Market/Job Categories/Sales and Business Development

hedline.hl1: World Business Briefing | Europe: Germany: Economic Views Vary

abstract.p: Germany's Ifo Institute reports in its monthly survey of businesses that sentiment rose in August to 90.8 from 89.3 in July; business people remain gloomy about current economic conditions, with retail sales still weak; manufacturers and wholesalers are more confident (S)

block.p: Germany's economy is still slumping, but hopes for a brighter future are taking hold. The Ifo Institute reported in its monthly survey of businesses that sentiment rose in August for the fourth consecutive month. The jump, to 90.8 from 89.3, in July was greater than analysts had expected. Business people remain gloomy about current economic conditions, with retail sales still weak. Manufacturers and wholesalers, however, are more confident.

Germany's economy is still slumping, but hopes for a brighter future are taking hold. The Ifo Institute reported in its monthly survey of businesses that sentiment rose in August for the fourth consecutive month. The jump, to 90.8 from 89.3, in July was greater than analysts had expected. Business people remain gloomy about current economic conditions, with retail sales still weak. Manufacturers and wholesalers, however, are more confident.
